Pre-Game Insights: Cyprus welcome Kosovo to Larnaca for their Group C2 UEFA Nations League clash on Monday, buoyed by an impressive win on matchday one as they look to build momentum in the group.
Cyprus have only lost one of their last five home games in the UEFA Nations League, built on a solid defensive foundation.
Kosovo have failed to score in four of their last five matches, highlighting their struggles in front of goal.
Cyprus’ recent matches have consistently seen few goals, with their last three competitive fixtures producing under 2.5 goals.
Cyprus will welcome Kosovo to Larnaca for their UEFA Nations League clash, following a morale-boosting win against Lithuania.
Kosovo will be looking for redemption after suffering a demoralising 3-0 defeat to Romania in their first match of the campaign.
The stakes are high for both teams. Cyprus, after their away triumph, have the opportunity to surpass their points total from the last Nations League with a second consecutive win.
Kosovo, bruised from their home defeat, will be eager to prove their resilience and avoid falling further behind in the group standings.
